alert.note: Alert for Eastern Lincoln County; South Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 30 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN LINCOLN COUNTY THROUGH 445 PM MDT... At 414 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Hondo, or 25 miles east of Ruidoso, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Hondo, Arabela, Tinnie, and San Patricio. This includes Highway 380 between Mile Markers 100 and 107. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Lincoln County; South Central Mountains
